### input:

llama2_trained_with_manual_labels_soluti:
we begin by distributing the $x$ on the left side of the equation: \begin{align*}
x\left(x(1+x)+2x\right)-3(x^2-x+2)&=x\left(x(1+x)+2x\right)-3x^2+3x\\
&=x\left(x(1+1)+2x\right)-3x^2+3x\\
&=x\left(x+2x\right)-3x^2+3x\\
&=x(3x-3x^2)+3x\\
&=\boxed{3x-3x^2+3x}.
\end{align*}
